column2: Alternative and/or augmentative communication devices used
Non-verbal communication through the use of facial expression, body postures and gestures
Vocalizes but does not have full speech, verbal approximations
Obsession or fascination with water and crinkly items, watching same show over and over
Repetitive stereotypic behavior, falling behavior, head-banging, OCD
Self-injurious behaviors, biting self when agitated

column3: Socially interested in others (may be a limited extent)

column2: Transition problems: difficulty adapting to change
Unique manitpulation of hands and feet
Cognitive decline/regression in some domains, in some patients
Judgement impaired - no sense of danger

column3: Dyspraxia - impaired ability to complete coordinated movements

column2: Oral motor impairment: tongue thrusting, sucking and swallowing disorders, frequent drooling, excessive chewing, mouthing behaviors, and feeding difficulties
Regression in fine and gross motor skills with age
Initiation and maintenance difficulties of sleep
Ankle pronation (need for surgery and orthotics on ankle and foot)
Craniofacial abnormalities (wide-set eyes, short filtturm, micrognathia, full lower lip, dysmorphic features)
Eye abnormalities (includes epicanthic folds, downslanting palpebral fissures, almond shaped eyes, short palprebal fissures,)
Hand and Foot abnormalities (arachnotidactyly fingers, curled fingers, Navicular bone drop, Calcaneal adduction)
Scoliosis (Increased curve in spine, excessive lumbar curve)
Leaky gut, unable to absorb nutrients
Mottled skin (Lacy pattern on the skin, circulation issues, white circles)
Sensitivity to heat and sun increased
